tool_description:
The Animetrics Face Recognition API can be used to find human faces, detect feature points, correct for off angle photographs, and ultimately perform facial recognition.  Information on facial features, including ears, nose, eyebrows, lips, chin are returned as coordinates on the image. The Animetrics Face Recognition API will also detect and return the gender and orientation, or "pose" of faces along 3 axes.

A special capability called "SetPose" is also available which allows the face to be re-rendered at a desired pose that is different than the captured pose. I.e. as if the photo was taken with respect to any desired angle relative to the camera.  This is typically used when the facial photo is captured off angle and a zero-corrected fully frontal image (0 degrees pitch, yaw, and roll) is required.

Detected facial features may be corrected or modified to improve the final results of subsequent steps. For example, an eye in the picture may be hidden or obscured; requesting just eye feature points, manually correcting their locations, and feeding this data into a more detailed request will help improve the accuracy of additional feature point and pose detection.
name: Animetrics Face Recognition
title: Animetrics Face Recognition

api_list.name: Add To Gallery
api_list.description: Adds an already enrolled Subject into an existing or uncreated Gallery.  Galleries that don't exist will automatically be created.

required_parameters.name: subject_id
required_parameters.description: The ID used to previously enroll some person (subject)

required_parameters.name: gallery_id
required_parameters.description: A unique ID indicating the collection to which the subject should be added.  If this gallery doesn't exist, it will be created.

api_list.name: Assign Face to Subject
api_list.description: Assign Face ID to a Subject ID. This operation will change the Subject ID associated with an individual Face ID. The Face ID that is required should be taken from the response of a previous enrollment. Assigning a Face ID to a new Subject ID who belongs to more than one gallery will affect that Subject's identity in each gallery. This operation might be used if several pictures of an individual are enrolled and then later it is found out that one of these pictures was in fact someone else.

required_parameters.name: subject_id
required_parameters.description: unique subject ID to replace that of a previous enrollment

required_parameters.name: face_id
required_parameters.description: face ID from the response of a previous enrollment

api_list.name: /v2/enroll
api_list.description: Computes a biometric signature for a known face ("subject") in a picture and adds it to a collection ("gallery") for later searching. The subject id and gallery id must be supplied in addition to an image id reference from a previous Detect or Detect Features call. A subject id must be a globally unique identifier for each known individual identity for each API key. Subjects may exist in more than one gallery and can be added to or removed from a gallery with the Add To Gallery and Remove From Gallery functions. Adding multiple pictures of the same subject will help improve matching accuracy. Similarly, adding pictures of different people with the same subject id will negatively affect the accuracy of the matching algorithm. Enroll operations also require a face hint describing which face in a picture is to be enrolled. This may be in the form of face bounds (topLeftX, topLeftY, width, height) or eye coordinates (leftEyeCenterX, leftEyeCenterY, rightEyeCenterX, rightEyeCenterY). These landmarks may all be taken from the output of Detect or Detect Features calls.

required_parameters.name: image_id
required_parameters.description: an image ID that was returned from a detect operation

required_parameters.name: subject_id
required_parameters.description: a unique ID describing this person

required_parameters.name: gallery_id
required_parameters.description: a unique ID indicating the collection to which the person should be enrolled

optional_parameters.name: topLeftX
optional_parameters.description: X-Coordinate for top left corner of face. May be modified from Detect output

optional_parameters.name: topLeftY
optional_parameters.description: Y-Coordinate for top left corner of face. May be modified from Detect output

optional_parameters.name: width
optional_parameters.description: Width of face. May be modified from Detect output

optional_parameters.name: height
optional_parameters.description: Height of face. May be modified from Detect output

optional_parameters.name: leftEyeCenterX
optional_parameters.description: (required if face coordinates/dimensions omitted) X-Coordinate for the left eye center. May be modified from Detect output

optional_parameters.name: leftEyeCenterY
optional_parameters.description: (required if face coordinates/dimensions omitted) Y-Coordinate for the left eye center. May be modified from Detect output

optional_parameters.name: righteyeCenterX
optional_parameters.description: (required if face coordinates/dimensions omitted) X-Coordinate for the right eye center. May be modified from Detect output

optional_parameters.name: rightEyeCenterY
optional_parameters.description: (required if face coordinates/dimensions omitted) Y-Coordinate for the right eye center. May be modified from Detect output

api_list.name: /v2/recognize
api_list.description: Matches an unknown face against a collection ("gallery") of known faces. Galleries are built using the Enroll function. Response includes a similarity score between 0 and 1 for all closely matching subjects in the gallery. A gallery id must be supplied in addition to an image id reference from a previous Detect or Detect Features call. Recognize operations require a face hint describing which face in a picture is to be enrolled. This may be in the form of face bounds (topLeftX, topLeftY, width, height) or eye coordinates (leftEyeCenterX, leftEyeCenterY, rightEyeCenterX, rightEyeCenterY). These landmarks may all be taken from the output of Detect or Detect Features calls.

required_parameters.name: gallery_id
required_parameters.description: a unique ID indicating the collection which this unknown person should be compared against

optional_parameters.name: image_id
optional_parameters.description: (required if face_id is omitted) image ID that was returned from a detect operation

optional_parameters.name: face_id
optional_parameters.description: (required if image_id omitted) face ID from the response of a previous enrollment

optional_parameters.name: max_num_results
optional_parameters.description: the maximum number of matches returned by this search (default 10)

optional_parameters.name: topLeftX
optional_parameters.description: X-Coordinate for top left corner of face. May be modified from Detect output

optional_parameters.name: topLeftY
optional_parameters.description: Y-Coordinate for top left corner of face. May be modified from Detect output

optional_parameters.name: height
optional_parameters.description: Height of face. May be modified from Detect output

optional_parameters.name: leftEyeCenterX
optional_parameters.description: (required if face coordinates/dimensions omitted) X-Coordinate for the left eye center. May be modified from Detect output

optional_parameters.name: leftEyeCenterY
optional_parameters.description: (required if face coordinates/dimensions omitted) Y-Coordinate for the left eye center. May be modified from Detect output

optional_parameters.name: rightEyeCenterX
optional_parameters.description: (required if face coordinates/dimensions omitted) X-Coordinate for the right eye center. May be modified from Detect output

optional_parameters.name: rightEyeCenterY
optional_parameters.description: (required if face coordinates/dimensions omitted) Y-Coordinate for the right eye center. May be modified from Detect output

optional_parameters.name: width
optional_parameters.description: Width of face. May be modified from Detect output

api_list.name: /v2/remove_from_gallery
api_list.description: Removes an already enrolled Subject from an existing Gallery. If this is the only subject in that Gallery, the Gallery will be deleted. If the Subject exists in no other Galleries, he will be deleted from the Face Recognition System.

required_parameters.name: subject_id
required_parameters.description: The ID used to previously enroll some person ("subject")

required_parameters.name: gallery_id
required_parameters.description: A unique ID indicating the collection from which the subject should be removed. If the subject exists in no other galleries, the biometric template will be removed from the Facial Recognition System and subsequent Add To Gallery operations for this subject will fail.

api_list.name: /v2/usage
api_list.description: Retrieve your current daily and monthly count of function calls made to the api. Total, billable, detect, enroll and recognize counts are displayed.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://animetrics.p.rapidapi.com/v2/usage"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "animetrics.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

url = "https://animetrics.p.rapidapi.com/v2/usage"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "animetrics.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: /v2/view_gallery
api_list.description: View the subject ids that have been enrolled in a specific gallery.

required_parameters.name: gallery_id
required_parameters.description: A unique ID indicating the gallery to query.

api_list.name: /v2/view_subject
api_list.description: View the face ids that have been enrolled in a specific subject.

required_parameters.name: subject_id
required_parameters.description: unique subject ID that matches one or more previous enrollments

api_list.name: /v2/add_to_gallery
api_list.description: Adds an already enrolled Subject into an existing or uncreated Gallery. Galleries that don't exist will automatically be created.

required_parameters.name: subject_id
required_parameters.description: The ID used to previously enroll some person ("subject")

required_parameters.name: gallery_id
required_parameters.description: A unique ID indicating the collection to which the subject should be added. If this gallery doesn't exist, it will be created.

api_list.name: /v2/assign_face_to_subject
api_list.description: Assign Face ID to a Subject ID. This operation will change the Subject ID associated with an individual Face ID. The Face ID that is required should be taken from the response of a previous enrollment. Assigning a Face ID to a new Subject ID who belongs to more than one gallery will affect that Subject's identity in each gallery. This operation might be used if several pictures of an individual are enrolled and then later it is found out that one of these pictures was in fact someone else.

required_parameters.name: face_id
required_parameters.description: face ID from the response of a previous enrollment

required_parameters.name: subject_id
required_parameters.description: unique subject ID to replace that of a previous enrollment

api_list.name: Remove From Gallery
api_list.description: Removes an already enrolled Subject from an existing Gallery.  If this is the only subject in that Gallery, the Gallery will be deleted.  If the Subject exists in no other Galleries, he will be deleted from the Face Recognition System.

required_parameters.name: subject_id
required_parameters.description: The ID used to previously enroll some person (subject)

required_parameters.name: gallery_id
required_parameters.description: A unique ID indicating the collection from which the subject should be removed.  If the subject exists in no other galleries, his biometric template will be removed from the Facial Recognition System and subsequent Add To Gallery operations for this subject will fail.

api_list.name: Verify
api_list.description: Verify if an unknown face (or collection of faces of an unknown individual) has the same identity as a claimed target. A similarity score is returned, and is optimized for discriminating the target subject from other individuals. Note that there must be at least two faces of the target subject enrolled.

required_parameters.name: subject_id_of_target
required_parameters.description: A unique subject ID of the known person (must have at least 2 faces enrolled)

optional_parameters.name: subject_id_of_unknown
optional_parameters.description: A unique subject ID of the person who's identity is to be verified

api_list.name: View Gallery
api_list.description: View the subject ids that have been enrolled in a specific gallery.

required_parameters.name: gallery_id
required_parameters.description: a unique ID indicating the gallery to query

api_list.name: View Subject
api_list.description: View the face ids that have been enrolled in a specific subject.

required_parameters.name: subject_id
required_parameters.description: unique subject ID that matches one or more previous enrollments

api_list.description: Computes a biometric signature for a known face ("subject") in a picture and adds it to a collection ("gallery") for later searching. The subject id and gallery id must be supplied in addition to an image id reference from a previous Detect or Detect Features call. A subject id must be a globally unique identifier for each known individual identity for each API key. Subjects may exist in more than one gallery and can be added to or removed from a gallery with the Add To Gallery and Remove From Gallery functions. Adding multiple pictures of the same subject will help improve matching accuracy. Similarly, adding pictures of different people with the same subject id will negatively affect the accuracy of the matching algorithm.  Enroll operations also require a face hint describing which face in a picture is to be enrolled. This may be in the form of face bounds (topLeftX, topLeftY, width, height) or eye coordinates (leftEyeCenterX, leftEyeCenterY, rightEyeCenterX, rightEyeCenterY). These landmarks may all be taken from the output of Detect or Detect Features calls.

api_list.name: List Galleries
api_list.description: Lists the galleries that have been created by your personal API key.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://animetrics.p.rapidapi.com/list_galleries"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "animetrics.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Delete Face
api_list.description: Delete a Face from a known Subject. This operation will only delete the individual Face that is associated with an enrollment transaction for a Subject. The Face ID that is required should be taken from the response of a previous enrollment. Deleteing a Face from a Subject who belongs to more than one gallery will affect that Subject's identity in each gallery. This operation might be used if several pictures of an individual are enrolled and then later it is found out that one of these pictures was in fact someone else who's identity is unknown.

required_parameters.name: face_id
required_parameters.description: face ID from the response of a previous enrollment

api_list.name: /v2/delete_face
api_list.description: Delete a Face from a known Subject. This operation will only delete the individual Face that is associated with an enrollment transaction for a Subject. The Face ID that is required should be taken from the response of a previous enrollment. Deleteing a Face from a Subject who belongs to more than one gallery will affect that Subject's identity in each gallery. This operation might be used if several pictures of an individual are enrolled and then later it is found out that one of these pictures was in fact someone else who's identity is unknown.

required_parameters.name: face_id
required_parameters.description: Delete a Face from a known Subject. This operation will only delete the individual Face that is associated with an enrollment transaction for a Subject. The Face ID that is required should be taken from the response of a previous enrollment. Deleteing a Face from a Subject who belongs to more than one gallery will affect that Subject's identity in each gallery. This operation might be used if several pictures of an individual are enrolled and then later it is found out that one of these pictures was in fact someone else who's identity is unknown.
